content.body: What a fun algorithm. It must have been invented before the <ol> element. https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/canvas.html#serialisation-of-a-color
Domenic: hah, Hixie enjoyed that kind of style a bit too much
content.formatted_body: Domenic: hah, Hixie enjoyed that kind of style a bit too much

content.body: I'm reading through https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/scripting.html#prepare-the-script-element and wondering. Do I understand correctly and step 31.11 (for fetching of the scripts) is done synchronously?
I mean, the fetching *starts* synchronously. The onComplete runs after the network gets back to us.
ok. When does step 33 run? immediately after fetch starts?
Yoav Weiss: after fetch goes in parallel
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: after fetch goes in parallel

content.body: Yoav Weiss: everything is essentially blocking until you go in parallel (HTML has created some confusion here by sometimes saying steps have to run synchronously, but the truth is they all run synchronously; we're slowly cleaning that up)
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: everything is essentially blocking until you go in parallel (HTML has created some confusion here by sometimes saying steps have to run synchronously, but the truth is they all run synchronously; we're slowly cleaning that up)

content.body: The "in parallel" part is defined outside the processing steps, in https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/scripting.html#the-script-element:attr-script-async-8 ?? Or somewhere else?
Yoav Weiss: presumably it's in Fetch, as I said, but there are sometimes things where HTML goes in parallel before it calls fetch, but that's also generally an anti-pattern
content.formatted_body: Yoav Weiss: presumably it's in Fetch, as I said, but there are sometimes things where HTML goes in parallel before it calls fetch, but that's also generally an anti-pattern

content.body: It just seems like step 33 assumes that the script is ready to be executed, and it's not immediately obvious to me how it can assume that. But at the same time, that lack of clarity (or lack of understanding on my part) doesn't block me atm. Thanks!!
